p: Of the UK cohort, 50% (8/16) of participants were positive for CMV IgG, while 100% (40/40) of the Senegalese cohort was positive ( Fig. 1 A), which is in line with previous reports in these populations ( Cannon et al., 2010; Adland et al., 2015). Titers of CMV IgG were comparable in UK CMV + and Senegalese participants. Ages of participants in the UK CMV âˆ’, UK CMV +, and Senegalese cohorts were comparable and did not correlate with CMV IgG titer ( Table S1). Demographics of both cohorts are summarized in Table S1.
